required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of JBT-101 in Systemic Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Multicenter Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of JBT-101 in Diffuse Cutaneous Systemic Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of JBT-101 in adult subjects with diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
Part A of the study is an interventional, double-blind, randomized, placebo-control design will be used to test safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of JBT-101 in subjects ≥ 18 and ≤ 70 years of age with active diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis. The screening period is up to 28 days, with 84 days treatment period and 28 days follow-up off active treatment.
Part B of the study is an interventional, open-label design will be used. All subjects who complete dosing in Part A without permanent discontinuation of study drug and who pass repeat safety screening will be eligible for enrollment. The screening period is up to 28 days, with a 364 day treatment period and 28 day follow up after last dose of JBT-101.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events from baseline at Day 113
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 112 days, with 84 day treatment and 28 day follow-up

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Combined Response Index in diffuse cutaneous Systemic Sclerosis (CRISS) from baseline at Day 85
primary_outcome.description: CRISS responders and its domains of modified Rodnan skin score, forced vital capacity percent predicted, Physician Global Assessment, Patient Global Assessment, and Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability-Index

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events from baseline at Day 394
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: 394 days, with 365 day treatment and 28 day follow-up

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Combined Response Index in diffuse cutaneous Systemic Sclerosis (CRISS) from baseline at Day 394
primary_outcome.description: CRISS responders and its domains of modified Rodnan skin score, forced vital capacity percent predicted, Physician Global Assessment, Patient Global Assessment, and Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability-Index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in patient-reported outcomes from baseline at Day 85
secondary_outcome.description: National Institutes of Health Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS)-29 Short Form, the PROMIS-29 Short Form single item pain numerical rating score, the 5-D Itch Score, and a Systemic Sclerosis Skin Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in JBT-101 plasma concentrations from baseline at Day 85
Change in metabolipidomic profile from baseline at Day 85
Change in blood biomarkers of disease activity, inflammation and fibrosis from baseline at Day 85
Change in skin biomarkers of inflammation and fibrosis from baseline at Day 85

arm_group.description: JBT-101 5 mg q am and placebo q pm on Days 1-28, then JBT-101 20 mg twice a day (bid) on Days 29-84.
JBT-101 20 mg q am and placebo q pm on Days 1-28, then JBT-101 20 mg bid on Days 29-84.

intervention.description: JBT-101 5 mg q am, 20 mg q am, or 20 mg bid on Days 1-28. JBT-101 20 mg bid on Days 29-84.
Placebo q pm (with JBT-101 5 or 20 mg q AM) or placebo bid on Days 1-28. Placebo bid on Days 29-84.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Part A
- Diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis
- Have skin thickening from SSc in a body area suitable for repeat biopsy
- Disease duration ≤ 3 years from the first non-Raynaud's phenomenon or >3 years and ≤ 6 years from the first non-Raynaud's phenomenon and high sensitivity C-reactive protein > 3 mg/L, high sensitivity interleukin-6 > 5 pg/mL, or increase in mRSS ≥ 5 points over the last 6 months with total RSS ≥ 12.
- Stable treatment for SSc for at least 28 days before Visit 1
Part B
•Completion of dosing in Part A without permanent discontinuation of study product because of safety or tolerability reasons.
Exclusion Criteria (Part A and B):
- Severe or unstable systemic sclerosis
- Significant diseases or conditions other than systemic sclerosis that may influence response to the study product or safety;
- Any one of the following values for laboratory tests at Screening:
1. A positive pregnancy test (or at Visit 1);
2. Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL
3. Neutrophils < 1.0 x 10^9/L
4. Platelets < 75 x 10^9/L
5. Creatinine clearance < 50 ml/min according to modified Cockcroft-Gault equation
6. Serum transaminases > 2.0 x upper normal limit
7. Total bilirubin ≥ 1.5 x upper limit of normal
- Any other condition that, in the opinion of the Principal Investigator, is clinically significant and may put the subject at greater safety risk, influence response to study product, or interfere with study assessments.

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Cornell Medical College, New York City, NY

facility.name: University of Texas Houston Medical School
